Aynƒ± Opposing Force gibi Blue Shift de Half-Life 1'deki olaylarƒ± ba≈üka bir karakterin g√∂z√ºnden anlatƒ±yor. Fakat bu seferki tanƒ±dƒ±k bir dost, Barney Calhoun. Bildiƒüiniz gibi Barney ana oyunun ba≈üƒ±nda g√∂rm√º≈üt√ºk. Oyunun ba≈üƒ±nda biz teleferik ile gezerken kapalƒ± bir kapƒ±yƒ± yumruklayan g√∂revli vardƒ±. ƒ∞≈üte o g√∂revli Barney. Zaten oyun ba≈üƒ±nda da aynƒ± olayƒ± birde Barney'in g√∂z√ºnden g√∂r√ºyoruz. Biz kapƒ±nƒ±n √∂n√ºndeyiz Gordon ise teleferik ile ge√ßiyor. 

Barney Half-Life 1'de ya≈üanan olaylar sƒ±rasƒ±nda Black Mesa'dan ka√ßmaya √ßalƒ±≈üƒ±yor. Bizde ona bu macerada e≈ülik ediyoruz. Dr. Rosenbarg gibi bilimadamlarƒ± da bizimle birlikte ka√ßmaya √ßalƒ±≈üƒ±yor. √áok baƒülƒ± g√∂z√ºksede ana oyunun hikayesinden farklƒ± bir hikayeyi anlatƒ±yor Blue Shift. Ufak tefek detaylar haricinde √ßok baƒülantƒ± kurmamƒ±≈ü yapƒ±mcƒ±lar. Hikaye diƒüer oyunlara g√∂re baya kƒ±sa tabi. En fazla 5-6 saat civarƒ± s√ºrer. 

Bunlar haricinde g√∂r√ºnt√º kalitesi oynanƒ±≈ü her≈üey ana oyun ile aynƒ±. Sadece Barney HEV giysisi giymiyor. Onun yerine √ßelik yelek tarzƒ± g√ºvenlik g√∂revlilerine g√∂re ekipmanlar kullanƒ±yor. HUD ve silahlarƒ±n g√∂r√ºnt√ºleri deƒüi≈üik fakat i≈ülevleri tamamen aynƒ±. 

Half-Life evrenini ve karakterleri daha yakƒ±ndan tanƒ±mak isteyen arkada≈ülar olursa bu oyunu oynayabilirler. G√ºzel bir klasik. Tavsiye ederim. 70SP

In Half-Life Blue Shift spielt man einen Wachman und erlebt seine Perspektive im Half-Life 1 gesechen.

Positives
+ Jetzt gibt es R√ºstung (Helm & Weste) die der Wachman tr√§gt anstellen eines Poweranzuges mit Energie.
+ 2 bis 3 kleine R√§tselaufgaben die so bisher noch nicht in Half-Life aufgetreten sind.

Negatives (was micht gest√∂rt hat)
- Es sind nur die Basewaffen von Half-Life 1 drinnen. im Vergleich zu Half-Life Opposing Force sind viel mehr Waffen drinnen (sogar mehr als im Basegame).
- Es ist k√ºrzer als Half-Life Opposing Force. Ich brauchte f√ºr Blue Shift 3,5 Stunden und f√ºr Opposing Force 7,5 Stunden, also das doppelte.

Achtung:
Ich habe mir die Games im Sommersale f√ºr wenig Geld geholt. Ich empfehle euch auf einen guten Sale zu warten um das Spiel zu kaufen.

You're probably expecting me to say how this game sucks. Well, I‚Äôm not really going to be doing that because I think this game is actually okay. 

Blue Shift doesn‚Äôt really add anything new, it‚Äôs just more of Half-life. I‚Äôll start with the Pros‚Ä¶.

PROS:
- It has Half-life 1‚Äôs gameplay so it‚Äôs pretty great.
- It expands the Half-life lore so I guess that‚Äôs cool
- You play as a Security Guard, the protagonist in Blue Shift is Barney Calhoun. Since you play as Calhoun, you get armor from taking vests and helmets off of dead Security Guards; I like this idea a lot because you can‚Äôt just use the HEV charging stations anymore, it makes the game feel a little bit more fresh.
- It adds in the HD pack, I don‚Äôt like the HD pack all that much but some people do; but I do like the shotgun model.

I guess that‚Äôs it, NOW FOR THE CONS‚Ä¶.

CONS:
- THERE‚ÄôS NO NEW ENEMIES OR NEW WEAPONS!!! Nothing is new at all.
- Dr. Rosenberg is so fu cking annoying: he gets stuck at walls, sometimes he doesn‚Äôt follow me and he doesn‚Äôt shut the fu ck up. At least I can kill him, but then the game resets. :(
- The soundtrack is barely visible, I only heard two tracks back in XEN and both tracks were forgettable as hell.
- Oh yeah and FU CKING XEN!!!!! YOU GO BACK TO XEN FOR A WHOLE CHAPTER AND IT‚ÄôS SO FU CKING TEDIOUS!!!
- The game is really short, shorter than Opposing Force. I think it‚Äôs about an hour long.

In Conclusion, I think this game is okay. For some reason, everyone likes kicking Blue Shift‚Äôs ballsack because it‚Äôs an easy target. Personally, I disagree with those people, but I can also see why they would think that way. Blue Shift is probably my fourth favorite Half-life game in the series, I think you should give Blue Shift a try if you played Half-life 1. Joel Vinesauce likes comparing HL1 and its expansions that Half-life 1 is kind of like the burger, Opposing force are the fries, and Blue Shift is the milkshake. I agree with that statement for some reason, I don‚Äôt know why.

Just play this game

P.S.
Speaking of Joel Vinesauce, he did this on his Blue Shift Stream: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZIVvKL4H1Ts

Half-Life: Blue Shift, la tercera expansion del Half-Life. Este juego si es algo corto pero su historia y trama es buena, obiamente deberas jugar al Half-Life 1 para entenderlo claro y por supuesto conocer a los personajes. El juego no es malo para nada de hecho aqui se originaron los modelos HD que despues fueron aplicados en Opposing Force y el Half-life original y el source tambien aunque en el source se ven un poco mejor. Este juego tambien nos relatara un poco sobre como empezaron los hechos en HL (Half-Life) y quien fue el causante. El juego si cuesta un poco asi que lo recomendable es esperar un descuento y steam siempre rebaja este juego y la saga claro. Lo recomiendo para fans y personas que les interesa la historia de la saga. Buen juego aunque sea corto muy bueno 90% recomendado.
Nota: Esta es MI opinion sobre el juego, no se busca ofender o dejar mal algun producto de valve en particular y a nadie.

Tened un buen dia y Buen gaming

[h1]Those elevators does my head in[/h1]

+ Play your cards right and the NPCs may help you out.
+ Impressive physics for its time and semi-destructible environment.
+ Fair amount of enemies and huge variety of weapons and explosives.
+ All around impressive sound effects and game soundtrack.
+ On your last round, then you're shit out of luck.

- OpenGL stuck at 75~100 fps (w/wo vsync) and the software renderer doesn't work.
- You may recall getting stuck in elevators (due to high fps) which still happens.
- No handholding (which is good) but you have to figure out everything by yourself.

I finished this game several times before I had steam. Classic Half-Life gameplay, though you'll finish this one in 5 hours, tops. Unlike Opposing Force there are no new weapons or enemies, but otherwise absolutely nothing to complain about.
I would recommend buying it in a Half-Life bundle.

Segunda expansi√≥n de Half Life, donde vemos la historia desde el punto de vista de Barney Calhoun (guardia de seguridad en las instalaciones de Black Mesa, el mismo que se ve golpeando una puerta al comienzo del HL original). Puede decirse que esta expansi√≥n aporta en lo que hace a la historia de la saga, ya que nos muestra como Barney y otros cient√≠ficos logran escapar del desastre que ocurri√≥ producto del experimento realizado por Gordon Freeman; conocemos al Dr. Rosenberg, quien nos habla de un teletransportador que finalmente usar√°n para huir de all√≠. Hay peque√±os segmentos del juego que se desarrollan en Xen, pero la mayor parte se da dentro de Black Mesa y tambi√©n veremos en varias ocasiones a Freeman, el protagonista de la saga. Como dije arriba, en lo que hace a la historia, Blue Shift da sus propios aportes; ahora bien, en la jugabilidad, compar√°ndolo con Opposing Force, no aporta nada nuevo (no hay ninguna innovaci√≥n), las armas, el ambiente y los dise√±os de los personajes son m√°s de lo mismo, incluso la m√∫sica de fondo que ponen para ciertos eventos es la misma que la de Opposing Force. La √∫nica diferencia con OF es que esta entrega no tiene modo multijugador, solo singleplayer. Tambi√©n hay que decir que esta historia es mucho m√°s corta que las otras entregas, en 2 horas o menos lo terminas, a menos que vuelvas a jugarlo, como es mi caso. M√°s all√° de eso, y siendo un fan de toda la saga, le doy un voto positivo porque cumple con la tarea de entretener, pero est√° m√°s que claro que OF lo supera ampliamente y por mucho. Mi calificaci√≥n: 8,5 / 10.

---short version---

-more or less same shooting fun of half life 1

-different perspective on the resonance cascade

-no cool sci fi guns from half life 1

---long version---
Half life blue shift attempts to show you the resonance cascade from a different perspective. gordens old freind barney. sadly you dont get to play with any of the cool alien or experimental black mesa weapons like in the original half life game. but you still get your cool shotgun and crowbar. they switch up the gameplay by making armour be a pickup instead of charging yourself at the hev stations. a good constant reminder that you are not gordon freeman. you only get armour from taking new body armour off of dead guards for the most part. all the same shooting goodness from half life 1 is still here just without the cool sci fi guns.

Having completed this game, I will say that I absolutely enjoyed it MORE than the original Half-Life! It cuts way down on the things about Half-Life that I hate, like all the terrible platforming, lame puzzles, and backtracking, and makes everything shine throughout a quicker paced adventure. I know lots of people love Half-Life, but I just found it OK, and I think this expansion is superior in every way. That's just my opinion, but I wasn't annoyed playing this, which is more than I can say for the original game.

H√°t r√∂videbb mint a Half Life 1 √©s az Opposing Force, de aki szereti a Half Life-t annak tetszeni fog ez is.Kev√©s a fegyver √©s az ellenfelek is ugyanazok, de att√≥l m√©g egy remek j√°t√©k.

The year was 2001. Month of July and back then I was 15 years old and I just got my hands on the PlayStation. But I was still glued to my Laptop because back then, I was playing a series of games from Valve called Half Life. Blue Shift was the first game I played because it was released a month ago, and let me tell you right now, I lost my mind. The game is just amazing. A real first person shooter with a compelling storyline that interwine with both Half Life and The Opposing Forces. In Blue Shift, I played the security guard, then I switched to Half Life where I played the Scientist. And switch again to OF where I played a member of a military force, all involved in a single disaster where they have to distroy the aliens from the outer space.  It's aint Fortnite or Battleground (which look like a puppy), Half Life deserves place in the Hall of Fame!
Half Life series brings back memories and was the greatest game of that year! Double Thumbs up!

Es una continuaci√≥n de Half life 1, el juego es m√°s de lo mismo que el primero. La jugabilidad, la dificultad y personajes siguen teniendo el mismo modo de juego. Lo bueno de este juego de aqu√≠ es que hay m√°s vida, m√°s recambios de armas pero ninguna arma diferente. Otra cosa que debo decir no s√© si ser√° un fallo del juego es que no puedes recargar el traje y no hay por el camino repuestos, supongo que ser√° un fallo del juego aunque aqu√≠ realmente es prescindible ya que no hay tantos enemigos. En general el juego est√° bien y tambi√©n recomiendo jugarlo.

Un troisi√®me sc√©nario de Half-Life encore sous un autre angle, toujours une super id√©e. Encore une fois il trois fois plus court que Opposing Force mais il est g√©nial, super sc√©nario, graphismes, gameplay tout est bon. Achetez le en promo.

ABOUT THAT BEER I OWED YA

Although the weaker of the two Half-Life 1 expansions, Blue Shift still manages to provide at least 5 or so hours of quality Half-Life gameplay without overstaying its welcome. It doesn't really bring anything new to the table, but that's OK when you consider that Blue Shift was pretty much intended to be a DLC of sorts for the main game. You can never go wrong with more Half-Life, (HDTF flashbacks intensify) so why not go ahead and give Valve some more of your hard-earned cash?
